data.title: Woodfired pizza oven
data.text: We love this sort of place and with our visit here it was proven why once more!  Try it.  Service and decor right up there.  Value very good during happy hr.

data.title: One of my hometown favorite eateries.
data.text: Every time somebody visits me from out of town, I usually take them to Flatbread for lunch. The food is excellent and in the summer you can sit outside.

data.title: Very nice
data.text: Love the atmosphere, my husband and I both had the pick two for lunch. Tomato and basil soup was awesome, pizzas were quite thin, which I love. Mark was our very attentive server. We are visiting the area but would love to go back. I too, like others ,  do not like the very uncomfortable chairs.

data.title: Went foe lunch bwforw lunxh crowd
data.text: The three if us vane her for lunch before it got busy,  but it took FOREVER to get served,  we had to ask for extra napkins twice, and were never offered Coke refills. Was very disappointed since previous visits had been more pleasant.

data.title: More than brick oven pizza!
data.text: Really good food and both indoor and outdoor service.  Super creative salads and entrees served  with high end dishes and flatware with cloth napkins.  The pick 2 option is the good deal.   Bloody Marys are served with sliced tomatoes, arugula and a bacon strip.  The service is fast and friendly.

data.title: Fun atmosphere, fabulous food
data.text:
I have a lot of dietary restrictions.  Fortunately for me, I can order flatbread with gluten-free crust, no tomato sauce, and goat cheese!  I can't find anything like this anywhere else.  We LOVE Flatbread for this reason.
On our last visit, our server, Mak, was so friendly and helpful!  
Wonderful place and terrific service!

data.title: Good service and great food
data.text: I've been here about a dozen times over the last 2 years.  Frankly I usually don't care for Flatbread Pizza, but these guys know how to cook!  Great Pizza, salads and sandwiches.  I have yet to try anything on the menu that I did not like.  Also, lunch appointments are good as the food arrives very quick after placing your order.

data.title: Great food, better ambiance
data.text: Love this place for casual dining, great salads, delicious flatbreads and fine service. Do ask for a booth, the tables are made from old doors. The wine and beer selections are plentiful.

data.title: Skimp on portions
data.text: Flatbread in Meridian used to be one of our favorite restaurants in town but last night we could definitely see how they are cutting back on portions such as on the scant amount of cheese fondue they brought out as our appetizer.  Then the apple chicken walnut salad was smaller than normal too.  Service was not as good either.  Hope they can improve or I don't think they'll survive.

data.title: Slow/Bad Service
data.text: This is the 2nd or 3rd time in the last several months we've been really disappointed. Two nights ago, REALLY slow service. Glasses were dirty, brought the wrong dressing for the salad, pizza really late getting served. They used to have much better service, seemed like too many people in the kitchen, and not on the floor. Pizza was good but not good enough to go back anytime soon. Really sad as it didn't used to be this way. Maybe a new manager?

data.title: Great Pizza
data.text: Mention isn't the typical pizza you may be looking for, but wait staff was knowledgeable and helped us pick an excellent pizza.  Would go again.

data.title: Yum
data.text: The food and service is always great. The chopped veggie pizzetta is my favorite plus the kale salad. And our kids love to make their own pizzas!

data.title: Special pizzas with a companion price, but definitely worth a try
data.text:
My wife is not a pizza person, but she has recently discovered "flatbread" pizza, with a crust that is not so "doughy".

Based upon the menu options, this pizzeria has many "special" choices outside the normal pizza place. It seemed to me to be out of place in downtown Meridian, like a Southern California menu dropped down into Idaho.

Our "Pick 2" lunch items were fresh, tasty and on the small side for the price. 

We liked the atmosphere. The service was ok, but the food was slow coming out of the "visible" kitchen and they seemed to take their time preparing the orders (they were not in a hurry even with a lengthy line of orders waiting to be filled).

They have indoor, outdoor and counter seating. This is worth a try, but with so many pizza places available you have to want the "speciality" items on their menu to be a return customer.

data.title: 50/50 after four visits
data.text:
I went there four times and had mixed results. The first time there I really loved the feel of the place,the decor was excellent and it was clean! Woohoo no sticky menus!

The service was a little slow, during each visit, but the food made up for it...at first.

The first two visits were great, we were so impressed that we brought my mother and brother ( visiting from Portland) there as an example of good food in Idaho. I'm not sure if we just picked a bad night, or what but the pizza toppings just slid off the crust, and the crust was nearly  black on the bottom, and yet doughy as could be on the top. Was it a fluke, not on three pizza's.

Guessing it was just a bad night or something my wife and I went there once more. Her pizza was perfect, mine was a mess, I thought about sending it back, but we didn't see the server again until we paid, and when I expressed my lack of excitement for the visit, the response was "Well I hope it's better next time."

We haven't returned.

data.title: Amazing Bacon Bloody Mary's and pizza
data.text: Bacon Bloody Mary's are the bomb.  Actually has a slice of bacon in it with tomato wedge. Pizza is made on flat bread.  Very favorable.

data.title: not that exciting
data.text: Maybe was indifferent but not outstanding and a week later could not remember. did not leave a glowing impression

data.title: Half & Half Option
data.text: Went here with a friend and had the small personal margarita pizza which was crisp with slightly chewy (desired) crust and a cup of the tomato basil soup.  It was delicious and hot.  I hate it when I order soup and it arrives lukewarm.  Kudos!

data.title: The soup, the soup, the soup!
data.text: I know that it says pizzeria in the name, but you need to try the Tomato Basil Soup! Also, the fondue is the best starter around, especially if you come during happy hour. This is a great place to catch up with friends because it is not obnoxiously loud and allows for real conversation. Enjoy!

data.title: Authentic flavor but not very filling
data.text: The pizza has great flavor but was small. Not a great value. I typically think of pizza as a cheap meal but this was one of the most expensive meals we had while visiting Boise.

data.title: Great food
data.text: Excellent food and great environment. Local to Meridian and not too fancy. Great casual dining with a fully stocked bar.
